intro: Erigeron petroiketes, commonly known as the mountain blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and meadows, thriving in well-drained soils. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron petroiketes is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
